      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method operates a game of battleship, by setting up the boards and then calling playGame().
        Parameters:
        args - is a String array that we ignore.

      • playGame

        public static void playGame()
        playGame() playGame operates the actual playing of the game. It allows each user to choose a target on their turn. It checks for whether a player is won, and eventually congraluates the winner. It takes no input. It returns nothing.

      • readTarget

        public static int readTarget()
        readTarget() This method reads in the coordinate the user enters for where they would like to fire. It takes no input.
        Returns:
        returns the input.

      • createPBoards

        public static void createPBoards()
        createsPBoards() This method creates empty boards for each user, Which they will use to track their attacks on the opponent's ships. It takes no input. It returns nothing.

      • getPlayerNames

        public static void getPlayerNames()
        getPlayerNames() This method gets the names of the players. It takes no input. It returns nothing.

        public static void setShip1(int w,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            int z)
        setShip1(w,x,y,z) This method takes in the coordinates player one entered that instruct where to place their ship, and calls methods that ensure they are valid and then place them on the board.
        Parameters:
        w - the first x coordinate.
        x - the first y coordinate.
        y - the second x coordinate.
        z - the second y coordinate. It returns nothing.

        w - the first x coordinate.
        x - the first y coordinate.
        y - the second x coordinate.
        z - the second y coordinate.
        s - the proper array of ships to be placed
        board - the proper board the user is placing their ships on
        pships - the proper array of ship placement. It returns nothing.

      • checkShip

        public static boolean checkShip(int x,
                                int y,
                                java.lang.String[][] board)
        checkShip(x, y, board) This method checks to ensure that the user is not overlapping two ships.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate to checks
        y - is the y coordinate to check
        board - is the proper board of the user
        Returns:
        is a boolean, true if there is no ship there and false if there is

      • setComplete

        public static boolean setComplete(boolean[] s)
        setComplete(s) This method checks to see whether or not the user has completed setting their ships
        Parameters:
        s - is the proper ship array of the user
        Returns:
        is a boolean, true if the user has finished setting and false if they haven't

      • missileFire

        public static void missileFire(java.lang.String[][] board,
                               int x,
                               int y,
                               java.lang.String[][] pboard,
                               int[][] ships)
        missileFire(board, x, y, pboard, ships) This method allows the user to fire a missile at their opponent. It returns whether it was a hit or a miss, and updates the player's pboard accordingly.
        Parameters:
        board - the proper board the user is placing their ships on
        x - is the x coordinate the user is firing at.
        y - is the y coordinate the user is firing at.
        pboard - is the proper array of the user's guesses.
        ships - the proper array of ships to be placed It returns nothing.

      • hitShip

        public static void hitShip(int x,
                           int y,
                           int[][] ships)
        hitShip(x,y,ships) This method checks whether a missile fire hit a ship or not.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate the user is firing at.
        y - is the y coordinate the user is firing at.
        ships - is the proper ship array to check. It returns nothing.

      • shipLife

        public static boolean shipLife(int[][] ships,
                               int i)
        shipLife(ships, i) This method checks to see whether a ship is dead or not.
        Parameters:
        ships - is the proper ship array to check
        i - is the proper ship to check the coordinates of
        Returns:
        is a boolean, true if the ship is dead and false if it is not

      • gameOver

        public static boolean gameOver(int[][] ships)
        gameOver(ships) This method checks to see whether a player has won - whether all of a players' ships have been vanquished.
        Parameters:
        ships - is the proper array of ships to check.
        Returns:
        boolean is true if the game is over, and false if it is not.
